<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.29
<SEQUENCE>8
<FILENAME>v19602exv10w29.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 10.29
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>exv10w29</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Exhibit&nbsp;10.29</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>AGREEMENT</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>&#147;STREETS OF LEGEND&#148; (a.k.a. &#147;QUATTRO NOZA&#148;)</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This agreement (the &#147;Agreement&#148;) is made and entered into as of March&nbsp;24, 2005, by and between
Sobini Films (&#147;Grantor&#148;) and Lions Gate Films Inc. (&#147;LGF&#148;) with respect to that certain motion
picture presently entitled &#147;Streets of Legend&#148; (a.k.a. &#147;Quattro Noza&#148;).
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">1. <B>Picture: </B>The &#147;Picture&#148; shall mean that certain motion picture presently entitled &#147;Streets of
Legend&#148; (a.k.a. &#147;Quattro Noza&#148;) and any and all versions thereof (if and as available) and all
&#147;bloopers&#148;, footage, trims and outtakes thereof (if and as available) (including, without
limitation, the Director&#146;s Cut and the Final Cut and any and all versions of each of the foregoing,
all versions rated by the Motion Picture Association of America and unrated versions of the
Picture, &#147;behind the scenes&#148;, &#147;making of&#148; and any and all other documentary or short films
concerning the Picture, and all footage, &#147;bloopers&#148;, trims and out-takes of each of the foregoing),
produced by, on behalf of or at Grantor&#146;s direction, in the year 2003, starring Robert Beaumont and
Brihanna Hernandez in the principal lead and supporting roles, written by Joey Curtis and Albert
Hernandez and directed by Joey Curtis.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2. <B>Territory: </B>The &#147;Territory&#148; shall mean and include each of the following: (a)&nbsp;United States of
America (including but not limited to, Guam. Saipan, Midway Island, the Trust Territory Islands,
the Caroline Islands, the Marshall Islands, the Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico and American Samoa)
(&#147;U. S.&#148;), its territories, possessions, trusteeships and commonwealths and all military bases,
ships at sea, airlines and oil rigs flying the flag of the U.S., (b)&nbsp;Canada (including, but not
limited to, Quebec, Prince Edward Island, the Northwest Territories, the Yukon Territories and
Newfoundland), its territories, possessions, trusteeships and commonwealths, and all military
bases, ships at sea, airlines and oil rigs flying the flag of Canada, and (c)&nbsp;for the purposes of
Television exploitation in the U. S. only (the &#147;Additional Television Territory&#146;&#146;), Bermuda and the
Bahamas Islands.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">3. <B>Rights Granted: </B>Grantor hereby grants to LGF, on an exclusive basis, all distribution rights in
and to the Picture and the underlying material with respect thereto throughout the Territory, under
copyright and otherwise, in all languages and in all media, whether now known or hereafter devised,
including, without limitation, all Theatrical, Non-Theatrical, Home Video, Television, and
ancillary and derivative rights in and to the Picture, by all methods of delivery, whether now know
or hereafter devised, including without limitation, all Internet Delivery Mechanisms, all as such
rights may be more specifically defined in Schedule &#147;A&#148;, which is attached hereto and incorporated
herein by this reference (collectively, the &#147;Rights&#148;), but expressly excluding the copyright in and
to the Picture, all soundtrack album, Electronic Publishing Rights, literary publishing (including,
without limitation, all print publication and novelization rights), merchandising rights, and all
remake, prequel and sequel rights (including, without limitation, any and all television spin-off
rights) in and to the Picture, except as otherwise set forth herein. Without limiting the
generality of the foregoing, the Rights granted to
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">




<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Streets of Legend&#148; (a.k.a. &#147;Quattro Noza&#148;)<BR>
DM.O6<BR>
Page 2 of 10

</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">LGF hereunder shall include, without limitation, the exclusive right to market,
advertise, promote and publicize the Picture in all media, whether now known or hereafter
devised.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;a.&nbsp;<U>Remakes, Prequels &#038; Sequels</U>: LGF&#146;s negotiation rights with respect to remakes,
prequels and sequels of the Picture shall be pursuant to the terms of that certain executed
employment agreement dated June&nbsp;6, 2000 (as amended) by and between Lions Gate Entertainment Corp., a corporation incorporated under the laws of British Columbia and Mark Amin with respect to the
employment of Amin.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;b.&nbsp;<U>Television Exploitation</U>: Upon LGF&#146;s receipt of Grantor&#146;s written request, which
written request must be received by LGF no later than December&nbsp;31, 2005 (the &#147;Television Notice&#148;),
LGF shall submit the Picture to Showtime for inclusion under LGF&#146;s pay television output agreement
with Showtime Networks (the &#147;Showtime Agreement&#148;). If LGF does not receive the Television Notice on
or before December&nbsp;31, 2005, then (i)&nbsp;LGF shall not submit the Picture to Showtime for inclusion
under the Showtime Agreement (except as otherwise set forth in this subparagraph), and (ii)&nbsp;LGF and
Grantor shall cooperate in connection with the sale of the first cycle Television Rights in and to
the Picture in the Territory. Following December&nbsp;31, 2005, Grantor shall have the right to issue
written notice to LGF requesting that LGF submit the Picture to Showtime for inclusion under the
Showtime Agreement (the &#147;Secondary Notice&#148;). Upon LGF&#146;s receipt of the Secondary Notice, LGF shall
have the right, but not the obligation, to submit the Picture to Showtime for inclusion under the
Showtime Agreement. If, following LGF&#146;s receipt of the Secondary
Notice, LGF elects not to submit
the Picture to Showtime for inclusion under the Showtime Agreement, then LGF and Grantor shall
continue to cooperate in connection with the sale of the first cycle Television Rights in and to
the Picture in the Territory until such time as such sale is complete. Any submission by LGF of the
Picture to Showtime for inclusion under the Showtime Agreement pursuant to the terms of this
subparagraph shall be subject to Showtime&#146;s right to accept or reject such submission pursuant to
the terms of the Showtime Agreement.
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">4. <B>Term: </B>The &#147;Term&#148; of this Agreement shall commence as of the date first written above and shall
terminate seven (7)&nbsp;years from LGF&#146;s initial commercial theatrical release of the Picture in the
Territory plus an additional six (6)&nbsp;month non-exclusive sell-off period. Notwithstanding the
foregoing, if the Picture is included in the Showtime Agreement pursuant to the terms of Paragraph
3(b) hereinabove, the Term, with respect to all rights necessary to give effect to the Showtime
Agreement, shall extend for the term of the Picture required under the Showtime Agreement. It is
understood and agreed that LGF shall not manufacture more Home Video devices during the last six
(6)&nbsp;months of the Term than it reasonably expects to sell during the Term exclusive of the sell-off
period (provided that no inadvertent over-manufacturing shall be deemed a breach of this
Agreement). Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, LGF shall have a right of first
negotiation (for a period of ten (10)&nbsp;days commencing prior to the expiration of the Term) with
respect to any extensions of the Term hereof.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">5. <B>Minimum Guarantee: </B>Not applicable.
</DIV>




<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">




<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Streets of Legend&#148; (a.k.a. &#147;Quattro Noza&#148;)<BR>
DM.O6<BR>
Page 3 of 10

</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">6. <B>Grantor P&#038;A Commitment; Release Commitment:</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;a.&nbsp;<U>Grantor P&#038;A Commitment</U>: Grantor shall spend no less than Two Hundred Thousand
Dollars ($200,000.00) (the &#147;Grantor P&#038;A Commitment&#148;) solely in connection with the print,
marketing, advertising and publicity costs for LGF&#146;s Theatrical release of the Picture in the
Territory. The Grantor P&#038;A Commitment shall be spent pursuant to a mutually approved budget (to be
negotiated in good faith by the parties) (the &#147;P&#038;A Budget&#148;). Any print and advertising expenditure
in connection with the initial commercial theatrical release of the Picture in excess of the
Grantor P&#038;A Commitment shall be subject to mutual written approval between the parties, which
approval shall not be unreasonably withheld by Grantor and shall be deemed rejected if not given
within five (5)&nbsp;days of Grantor&#146;s receipt of LGF&#146;s written request for such approval. If any such
additional print and advertising costs are paid for by LGF, such costs shall be recoupable as
Distribution Expenses pursuant to the terms of Paragraph&nbsp;7 hereinbelow.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;b.&nbsp;<U>Release Commitment</U>: LGF shall cause the initial commercial theatrical release of
the Picture on one (1)&nbsp;screen in the Territory.
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">7. <B>Financial Terms:</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;a.&nbsp;<U>Grantor&#146;s Participation</U>: From One Hundred Percent (100%) of all monies received by
LGF on a non-refundable basis from the exploitation of the Picture in all media throughout the
Territory, LGF shall be entitled to deduct the following on a continuing basis and in the following
order: (i)&nbsp;LGF&#146;s Distribution Fee for all media; and (ii)&nbsp;LGF&#146;s Distribution Expenses (as that term
is defined hereinbelow), but expressly excluding the Grantor P&#038;A Commitment. All revenues remaining
after the foregoing deductions shall be referred to herein as &#147;AGR&#148;. The AGR shall be allocated One
Hundred Percent (100%) to Grantor. That portion of the AGR allocated to Grantor pursuant to this
paragraph shall be referred to herein as &#147;Grantor&#146;s
Participation&#148;. LGF shall be entitled to
cross-collateralize all revenues received by LGF in connection with the Picture from all media
throughout the Territory for the purposes of recouping LGF&#146;s recoupable Distribution Expenses and
the Home Video Advance (as that term is defined hereinbelow). LGF shall not be entitled to
cross-collateralize revenues received by LGF from the exploitation of the Picture with revenues
received by LGF in connection with any other motion picture property. The Picture shall not be used
as a loss-leader. If LGF includes the Picture in a package of films licensed to a third party, then
the price allocated to the Picture shall be on the basis of a reasonable allocation of revenues in
light of the commercial worth of the motion pictures in the package, as determined by LGF in the
exercise of its reasonable good faith business judgment.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;b.&nbsp;<U>Home Video Advance</U>: As an advance against Grantor&#146;s Participation, Grantor shall be
entitled to receive a &#147;Home Video Advance&#148; for the Picture in an amount equal to Fifty Percent
(50%) of Grantor&#146;s projected share of AGR derived from the Initial Home Video Release (as that term
is defined hereinbelow) of the Picture, as projected by LGF in its reasonable good faith business
judgment (which projection shall include a reserve for returns based upon LGF&#146;s reasonable good
faith business judgment). As used herein, &#147;Initial Home Video Release&#148; shall be the period
commencing on LGF&#146;s initial Home Video Street Date for the Picture and
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Streets of Legend&#148; (a.k.a. &#147;Quattro Noza&#148;)<BR>
DM.O6<BR>
Page 4 of 10

</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">continuing until the end of the calendar quarter during which LGF&#146;s initial Home Video
Street Date for the Picture occurs. Grantor hereby acknowledges and agrees that the AGR projection
made by LGF pursuant to the terms of this paragraph is an estimate that is subject to change and
that the financial information contained therein is not a true and accurate statement of the actual
amount of revenues that will be collected by LGF or the actual amount of revenues payable to
Grantor. Grantor shall not rely on any information contained in any such projection for any purpose
whatsoever. Grantor shall not have the right to dispute such projection (or any and all components
thereof). One Hundred Percent (100%) of the Home Video Advance shall be payable thirty (30)&nbsp;days
following the end of the first calendar quarter during which LGF&#146;s initial Home Video Street Date
for the Picture occurs (unless LGF&#146;s initial Home Video Street Date for the Picture occurs in the
second half of such quarter, in which event the Home Video Advance shall be payable ninety (90)
days following the end of the first calendar quarter during which LGF&#146;s initial Home Video Street
Date for the Picture occurs). Notwithstanding the foregoing, if LGF&#146;s initial Home Video Street
Date for the Picture is less than thirty (30)&nbsp;days prior to the end of the calendar quarter, then
One Hundred Percent (100%) of the Home Video Advance shall be payable thirty (30)&nbsp;days following
the end of the second calendar quarter following LGF&#146;s initial Home Video Street Date for the
Picture.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;c.&nbsp;LGF&#146;s &#147;Distribution Fee&#148; shall equal Fifteen Percent (15%) of One Hundred Percent (100%) of
all Gross Receipts received by LGF from the exploitation of the Picture in all media throughout the
Territory.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;d.&nbsp;As used herein, &#147;Distribution Expenses&#148; shall mean, with respect to all rights granted to
LGF hereunder, one hundred percent (100%) of the aggregate of all actual, direct, out-of-pocket,
third party costs expended or incurred by LGF in direct connection with the distribution and
exploitation of the Picture throughout the Territory in all media, including, without limitation,
all DLT Creation Costs, and all conversion, manufacturing, duplication, shipping, marketing,
advertising, promotion and publicity costs, and all costs to complete Delivery of the Picture (to
the extent (i)&nbsp;LGF elects to cure any failure of Grantor to complete Delivery of the Picture in
accordance with the Delivery Schedule and/or (ii)&nbsp;LGF is required to take &#147;access&#148; to any Delivery
Materials pursuant to the Delivery Schedule; and/or (iii)&nbsp;Grantor is not required to deliver such
elements under the Delivery Schedule). The Grantor P&#038;A Commitment shall not be included in
Distribution Expenses hereunder.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;e.&nbsp;<U>Home Video Marketing Expenses</U>: Grantor and LGF shall mutually approve the initial
marketing budget for the initial Home Video exploitation of the Picture in the Territory, which
budget shall include the advertising, duplication and DVD authoring, compression and replication
costs (the &#147;Approved Marketing Budget&#148;). LGF shall have the right to reallocate the subcategories
contained in the Approved Marketing Budget for the Picture and shall have the right to spend up to
ten percent (10%) above the Approved Marketing Budget. Commencing as of the date that is twelve
(12)&nbsp;months following LGF&#146;s initial Home Video Street Date for the Picture, LGF&#146;s Home Video
marketing expenses shall not exceed an amount that is equal to twelve percent (12%) of the Gross
Receipts received by LGF from the exploitation of the Home Video Rights in and to the Picture.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Streets of Legend&#148; (a.k.a. &#147;Quattro Noza&#148;)<BR>
DM.O6<BR>
Page 5 of l0

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;f.&nbsp;<U>DLT Creation Costs</U>: As used herein, the term &#147;DLT Creation Costs&#148; shall
mean and include 100% of LGF&#146;s actual, direct, out-of-pocket, third party costs of creating the
Digital Linear Tape (&#147;DLT&#148;) for the Picture, including, without limitation, DVD mastering and
authoring costs, manufacturing, duplication, and shipping and clearance costs (including, without
limitation, the cost of clearing &#147;bonus&#148; materials for such DVD).
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">8. <B>Delivery: </B>Grantor shall Deliver, at Grantor&#146;s sole cost and expense, all Delivery Materials set
forth in the Delivery Schedule that are required to constitute complete Delivery on or before
September&nbsp;30, 2005 (the &#147;Delivery Date&#148;). If any of the Delivery Materials are incomplete or fail
to meet LGF&#146;s technical requirements, LGF shall notify Grantor in writing specifying the defects in
the Delivery Materials (the &#147;Defect Notice&#148;). Such Defect Notice shall be delivered within
forty-five (45)&nbsp;days of LGF&#146;s receipt of all Delivery Materials set forth in the Delivery Schedule.
Grantor shall have fifteen (15)&nbsp;days from its receipt of the Defect Notice in which to cure the
defects set forth therein (the &#147;Delivery Cure Period&#148;). If Grantor fails to cure the defects set
forth in the Defect Notice prior to the expiration of the Defect Cure Period, then, without
limitation to LGF&#146;s other available rights and remedies, LGF shall have the option in its sole
discretion to (A)&nbsp;secure acceptable replacement materials and deduct the costs thereof from
Grantor&#146;s Participation, or any other monies owing to Grantor pursuant to this Agreement, or (B)
determine that it is economically prohibitive or otherwise unfeasible to secure acceptable
replacement materials and, as a result, terminate this Agreement upon written notice to Grantor. In
the event that LGF elects to terminate this Agreement, LGF shall be (I)&nbsp;relieved of its obligations
hereunder, and (II)&nbsp;Grantor shall reimburse LGF for all of LGF&#146;s out-of-pocket costs theretofore
incurred by LGF under this Agreement. Without limitation to those requirements set forth in the
Delivery Schedule, all documents required to be Delivered to LGF pursuant to the Delivery Schedule
shall be Delivered in the English language.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;a.&nbsp;<U>Running Time</U>: The Picture shall be Delivered to LGF have a running time of not less
than ninety (90)&nbsp;minutes, nor more than one hundred ten (110)&nbsp;minutes, inclusive of main and end
titles.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;b.&nbsp;<U>Rating</U>: The Picture shall be delivered to LGF having been judged to receive a
rating by the M.P.A.A. that is no more restrictive than &#147;R&#148;.
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">9. <B>Credits; Editing: </B>LGF shall have the right to cut, edit, change or add to, delete from or revise
the Picture, including the title, for M.P.A.A. rating purposes, to conform the Picture to LGF&#146;s
marketing campaign and for any other reason as LGF may in its sole discretion determine. Subject
only to Grantor&#146;s third party contractual restrictions delivered to LGF, Grantor&#146;s credit, and/or
any guild restrictions which Grantor has informed LGF are applicable to the Picture in writing not
later than the Delivery Date. LGF may, in its sole discretion, determine and arrange the placing
and size of credits including credits above the title and/or above the artwork title. Without
limiting the generality of the foregoing, LGF shall have the right to place its name and logo on
all materials concerning the Picture in the Territory, including, without limitation, in the main
and end credits of the Picture (e.g., LGF&#146;s customary presentation credit), in the billing block,
and on all advertising materials. It is the essence of this Agreement that Grantor Deliver written
notice of all credit, name and likeness obligations and restrictions and all third party
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">




<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Streets of Legend&#148; (a.k.a. &#147;Quattro Noza&#148;)<BR>
DM.O6<BR>
Page 6 of l0

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">contractual approval and consultation rights to LGF in writing on or before the Delivery
Date. Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, in the event that a performer or other
agreement containing a credit, name and/or likeness provision or approval or consultation right is
unexecuted as of such Delivery Date, then Grantor shall deliver the most recent draft of such
agreement to LGF and LGF shall have the right to rely thereon. Without limiting the generality of
the foregoing, in the event that a performer or other agreement containing a credit, name and/or
likeness and/or approval or consultation provision is unexecuted as of the Delivery Date, then any
and all contractual credit, name and likeness obligations and restrictions and approval rights
negotiated after such Delivery Date must be approved by LGF in writing prior to Grantor entering
into any agreement with respect thereto. LGF shall not remove any credit or copyright notice
appearing on screen as the Picture is Delivered to LGF except as follows: (i)&nbsp;to comply with a
court order or the order of an arbitrator or mediator, (ii)&nbsp;as required in settlement of a dispute,
or (iii)&nbsp;as required by law. No casual or inadvertent failure by LGF or any third party to comply
with any credit, name or likeness obligation or restriction, or to comply with any approval or
consultation right, shall be deemed a breach of this Agreement, provided that LGF takes all
commercially reasonable steps to cure such failure on a prospective basis commencing on LGF&#146;s
receipt of written notice thereof. The sole remedy of Grantor for a breach of any of the provisions
of this Paragraph&nbsp;9 shall be an action at law for compensatory damages, it being agreed that in no
event shall Grantor be entitled to consequential or punitive damages, or to seek or obtain
injunctive relief, specific performance, or any other form of equitable relief, by reason of any
breach or threatened breach of any of the credit, name, likeness or other obligation or restriction
or approval or consultation right, nor shall Grantor be entitled to enjoin or restrain the
exhibition, distribution, marketing, advertising, promotion, or other exploitation of the Picture.
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">10. <B>Holdbacks: </B>LGF shall control the release dates of the Picture by means of the Home Video Rights
as well as all television exhibition in Mexico (in the English and Spanish languages): provided
that Grantor&#146;s distributor(s) of the Picture in Mexico shall each be entitled to release the
Picture day and date with LGF&#146;s initial commercial release of the Picture in like media in the
Territory. When applicable, LGF shall also control the wholesale and suggested retail price of the
distribution of the Picture by means of the Home Video Rights in Mexico (in the English and Spanish
languages): provided that Grantor&#146;s distributor(s) of the Picture in Mexico shall each be entitled
to release the Picture by means of the Home Video Rights at the same price point as LGF&#146;s release
of the Picture in the Territory. Grantor shall use all reasonable good faith efforts to cause the
distributor(s) of the Picture in Mexico to each confirm in writing its acknowledgement of such
holdback and price restrictions.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">11. <B>Grantor&#146;s Representations and Warranties: </B>Grantor represents and warrants as of the date hereof
and also upon Delivery of the Picture that: (a)&nbsp;there are no non-customary credit, name or likeness
obligations or restrictions or approval or consultation rights applicable to the Picture (all of
which, if any, shall be Delivered to LGF in writing on or before the Delivery Date and LGF shall
have the right to rely thereon) and that LGF shall have the right, but not the obligation, to
utilize the likeness and name of each of the principal cast members in the artwork and in trailers
for the Picture: (b)&nbsp;Grantor owns or controls all Rights granted to LGF under this Agreement and
that all such Rights are free of all liens, claims, charges, encumbrances, restrictions, and
commitments; (c)&nbsp;there is no agreement concerning the Picture with any person or entity which, if
breached, would or
</DIV>




<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">




<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Streets of Legend&#148; (a.k.a. &#147;Quattro Noza&#148;)<BR>
DM.O6<BR>
Page 7 of 10

</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">could in any way impair, interfere with, abrogate or adversely or otherwise affect any of the
Rights granted to LGF under this Agreement: (d)&nbsp;LGF&#146;s exploitation of the Picture will not be
subject to any guild (e.g., WGA. DGA, and SAG) liens, or residuals; (e)&nbsp;it is a corporation duly
formed and validly existing in good standing under the laws of California and has the full right,
power, legal capacity and authority to enter into and carry out the terms of this Agreement: (f)
neither the Picture, nor any part thereof, nor any materials contained therein or synchronized
therewith, nor the title thereof, nor the exercise of any Right, license or privilege granted to
LGF hereunder, violates or will violate, or infringes or will infringe, any trademark, trade name,
service mark, patent, copyright (whether common law or statutory), or, to the best of Grantor&#146;s
knowledge, the literary, dramatic, musical, artistic, personal, private, civil, &#147;droit moral&#148; or
property right or rights of privacy or any other right of any person or entity whatsoever, or
unfairly competes with or slanders or libels (or constitutes a trade disparagement of) any person
or entity whatsoever; (g)&nbsp;it has no agreement with or obligations to any third party with respect
to the Picture which might conflict or interfere with any of the provisions of this Agreement or
the use or enjoyment by LGF of any of the Rights granted; (h)&nbsp;the Rights granted to LGF herein have
not been previously granted, licensed sold, assigned, transferred, conveyed or exploited by any
person or entity and Grantor shall not sell, assign, transfer, convey to or authorize any person or
entity any right, title or interest in and to the Picture or any part thereof or in and to the
dramatic or literary material upon which the Picture is based, which is adverse to or in derogation
of the Rights granted to LGF; (i)&nbsp;there is no litigation, arbitration, claim, demand, or
investigation pending or threatened with respect to the Picture, or the literary, dramatic or
musical material upon which the Picture is based or which is contained therein, or concerning the
physical properties thereof; (j)&nbsp;Grantor has secured, or by the Delivery Date will have secured,
and shall for the duration of this Agreement maintain, all clearances (including, without
limitation, all music rights and music clearances) which arc necessary for LGF to use and enjoy the
Rights granted to LGF in and to the Picture throughout the Territory for the duration of the Term
and that no supplemental or additional use payments shall be required with respect to the
exploitation of the Picture (or any portion or element thereof, including, without limitation, the
music contained therein) and/or any use or exploitation of any advertising or promotion of the
Picture which contains the music as embodied in the Picture (including &#147;in-context&#148; uses thereof):
and (k)&nbsp;Grantor is in all respects in compliance with the requirements of the Child Protection and
Obscenity Enforcement Act of 1988, as amended by the Child Protection Restoration and Penalties
Enhancement Act of 1990, and all rules and regulations promulgated thereunder (collectively, the
&#147;CPOEA&#148;) and that the Picture is in all respects in compliance with the requirements of the CPOEA, and does not contain any material that would require Grantor to comply with the recordkeeping
requirements of the CPOEA,
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">12. <B>Indemnities:</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;a. Grantor shall indemnify, defend and hold harmless LGF, its parent, subsidiaries,
affiliates, assignees, licensees, sublicensees, distributors, sub-distributors and dealers, and the
directors, officers, agents, consultants and representatives of the foregoing (the &#147;LGF
Indemnitees&#148;), from all claims, costs, liabilities, obligations, judgments or damages (including
reasonable outside attorneys&#146; fees but excluding lost profits and consequential damages), arising
out of or for the purpose of avoiding any suit, claim, proceeding or demand or the settlement
thereof, which may be brought against any of the LGF Indemnitees by reason of the actual or
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">




<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Streets of Legend&#148; (a.k.a. &#147;Quattro Noza&#148;)<BR>
DM.O6<BR>
Page 8 of 10

</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">proposed production of the Picture, or the use or disposition of rights granted herein,
or in connection with the breach of any of the warranties, representations or obligations made
by Grantor, unless resulting from a breach of this Agreement by LGF.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;b. LGF shall indemnify, defend and hold harmless Grantor, its parent, subsidiaries,
affiliates, assignees, and the directors, officers, agents, consultants and representatives of the
foregoing (the &#147;Grantor Indemnitees&#148;), from all claims, costs, liabilities, obligations, judgments
or damages (including reasonable outside attorneys&#146; fees but excluding lost profits and
consequential damages), arising out of or for the purpose of avoiding any suit, claim, proceeding
or demand or the settlement thereof, which may be brought against any of the Grantor Indemnitees by
reason of the distribution, advertising or promotion of the Picture, or in connection with the
breach of any of the warranties, representations or obligations made by LGF, except to the extent
that LGF is required to be indemnified by Grantor in accordance with paragraph 12(a) hereinabove.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;c. The parties hereto shall meaningfully consult with each other with respect to the defense,
institution or settlement of litigation in connection with the rights granted hereunder and LGF&#146;s
exploitation thereof during the Term and in the Territory.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">13. <B>Reporting Periods</B>: Following exploitation by LGF of the rights granted herein, customary
reporting shall be rendered to Grantor quarterly for the duration of the Term. Statements and
payments shall be delivered to Grantor simultaneously and shall be delivered within ninety (90)
days of each reporting period.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">14. <B>Audit Rights: </B>Grantor shall have the right to have a certified public accountant of its choice
audit LGF&#146;s books and records with respect to the Picture(s) once per year (and only once with
respect to any particular records and/or statements) at Grantor&#146;s sole cost and expense: such audit
shall take place in LGF&#146;s principal place of business and shall not unreasonably interfere with
LGF&#146;s course of business. Said audit shall be conducted at LGF&#146;s principal place of business during
normal business hours. Grantor shall give LGF ten (10)&nbsp;business days prior written notice of its
intent to conduct such audit. All notices, statements and payments made pursuant to the Agreement
shall be deemed valid and shall not be subject to dispute or audit unless disputed within
twenty-four (24)&nbsp;months after first issued. In the event that an audit reveals (i)&nbsp;an underpayment
of seven and one-half percent (7.5%) or more of the total monies owed; (ii)&nbsp;the underpayment is
seven thousand five hundred dollars ($7,500.00) or more, and (iii)&nbsp;the amount of the audit is
reasonable and customary and does not exceed the amount of the underpayment, then LGF shall pay
Grantor the amount of the underpayment plus the reasonable, actual, direct, out-of-pocket, third
party costs of the audit up to the amount of the underpayment.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">15. <B>Assignment: </B>LGF may grant, assign or sublicense this Agreement or any of its rights or
obligations herein to any third party: provided that LGF shall remain primarily liable for its
obligations hereunder unless such assignment is to (i)&nbsp;a parent, subsidiary or affiliated entity of
LGF, (ii)&nbsp;a company that acquires all or substantially all of LGF&#146;s assets, and/or (iii)&nbsp;is to a
&#147;major&#148; or &#147;mini-major&#146;&#146; studio, and, in any event, provided that LGF shall remain secondarily
liable for its payment obligations hereunder. Grantor shall not assign this Agreement or any of
</DIV>




<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">




<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Streets of Legend&#148; (a.k.a. &#147;Quattro Noza&#148;)<BR>
DM.O6<BR>
Page 9 of 10

</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">their rights or obligations herein except that after Delivery of the Picture is accepted by
LGF. Grantor shall have the right to assign its right to receive payment on three (3)&nbsp;occasions in
bulk during the Term. Any purported assignment in violation of this Agreement shall be null and
void.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">16. <B>No Third Party Beneficiaries: </B>Nothing contained in this Agreement shall be construed so as to
create any third party beneficiary hereunder. In this regard, nothing under this Agreement shall
entitle any third party to any remedies against LGF, at law, in equity, or otherwise, including,
without limitation, any additional audit rights or the right to seek or obtain injunctive relief
against LGF&#146;s distribution of the Picture.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">17. <B>Default: </B>If Grantor defaults (or breaches a material representation and warranty), which
default remains uncured for fifteen (15)&nbsp;business days following Grantor&#146;s receipt of LGF&#146;s written
notice to Grantor thereof, LGF shall be entitled to terminate this Agreement. In the event that
Grantor fails to fully Deliver the Delivery Materials set forth in the Delivery Schedule, which
failure is not timely cured, LGF may create such Delivery Materials, the reasonable, actual,
out-of-pocket cost of which shall be recoupable by LGF, in LGF&#146;s sole discretion, as (i)&nbsp;as a
Distribution Expense, and/or (ii)&nbsp;from any other monies (e.g. Grantor&#146;s Participation, bonuses,
etc.) which are then due and owing to Grantor, LGF&#146;s rights and remedies shall be cumulative, and
none of them shall be exclusive of any other allowed by law. If LGF defaults, Grantor shall not be
entitled to terminate or rescind this Agreement, nor to obtain injunctive relief with respect to
the exercise by LGF of the rights granted hereunder and Grantor further waives all rights to seek
and recover punitive damages; Grantor&#146;s sole remedy shall be an action at law for damages.
Notwithstanding the foregoing, LGF shall not be entitled to seek or obtain injunctive or equitable
relief with respect to the exploitation of the Picture outside the Territory.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">18. <B>Governing Law; Jurisdiction: </B>This Agreement shall be construed and interpreted pursuant to the
Laws of the State of California as it applies to contracts entered into and performed wholly within
California or, if appropriate, the federal laws of the United States of America. Any dispute
regarding the validity, construction, terms or performance of this Agreement or any other matter
in connection therewith shall be submitted to binding arbitration before the JAMS in Los Angeles.
California in accordance with the following provisions:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;a. If the parties cannot agree upon a single arbitrator, each party shall select one
arbitrator who has experience in the motion picture industry and both arbitrators so selected shall
select a third arbitrator.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;b. The third arbitrator shall adjudicate the dispute applying the laws of the state of
California as it applies to contracts entered into and wholly performed within California or, if
appropriate, the federal laws of the United States of America.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;c. The arbitrator shall issue a written opinion specifying the basis for their award and the
types of damages awarded.
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">




<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Streets of Legend&#148; (a.k.a. &#147;Quattro Noza&#148;)<BR>
DM.O6<BR>
Page 10 of l0

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;d. There shall be a court reporter record made of the arbitration hearing and said record
shall be the official transcript of the proceedings.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;e. Witness lists, production of documents and subpoenas in the arbitration shall be in
accordance with Section&nbsp;1280 et seq. of the California Code of Civil Procedure, except that the
fifteen (15)&nbsp;day periods set forth in subsections (a)(2)(A) and (B)&nbsp;of Section&nbsp;1282.2 shall be
deemed to be periods of five (5)&nbsp;business days. If the dispute pertains to Delivery, there shall be
made available to the arbitrator all relevant materials submitted by LGF or Grantor which purport
to constitute completion and delivery of the Picture. The parties shall participate in an exchange
of information before the hearing. If any such discovery is not voluntarily exchanged among the
parties, the party desiring such discovery may apply to the arbitrator at the outset of the
arbitration for particular discovery requests. The arbitrator may deny only such discovery as is
unreasonable or is intended to unduly delay the prompt conclusion of me arbitration.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;f. The decision of the arbitrator (or the majority of the arbitrators, if applicable) shall be
binding upon the parties, shall constitute a full and final adjudication of the controversy. The
parties shall each be responsible for paying fifty percent (50%) of all the arbitrator&#146;s and court
reporter&#146;s fees (including, without limitation, the cost of the arbitration), unless the arbitrator
for the majority of the arbitrators, if applicable) decides otherwise. A judgment upon the award
rendered by the arbitrators may be entered in any court having jurisdiction thereof.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Agreement (inclusive of Schedule &#147;A&#148;, Exhibit &#147;A&#148; and Exhibit &#147;C&#148;), when executed, is
legally binding unless and until superseded by a more formal agreement incorporating the terms set
forth above as well as additional provisions, which when and if executed, shall replace this
Agreement, Capitalized terms used herein and not otherwise defined shall have the same meaning as
in LGF&#146;s standard long-form agreement, subject to good faith negotiations in accordance with LGF&#146;s
and Grantor&#146;s standard business practices. All items not addressed above shall be negotiated in
good faith pursuant to prevailing industry customs and standards and LGF&#146;s and Grantor&#146;s standard
business practices. This Agreement may not be changed, modified, amended or supplemented, except in
a writing signed by both parties.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>AGREED TO AND ACCEPTED BY:</B>
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;
</DIV>

<FILENAME>v19602exv10w30.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 10.30

<HEAD>
<TITLE>exv10w30</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#FFFFFF">
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">




<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Exhibit&nbsp;10.30</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>AGREEMENT</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="Center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>&#147;THE WAY OF THE PEACEFUL WARRIOR&#148; a/k/a &#147;PEACEFUL WARRIOR&#148;</B>

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This agreement (the &#147;Agreement&#148;) is made and entered into as of December&nbsp;6, 2005 by and
between Sobini Films, a California Corporation (&#147;Grantor&#148;), whose address is 2700 Colorado Avenue,
Suite&nbsp;510B, Santa Monica, California, 90404, and Lions Gate Films Inc. (&#147;LGF&#148;), whose principal
address is 2700 Colorado Avenue, Second Floor, Santa Monica, California, 90404, with respect to
that certain motion picture presently entitled &#147;The Way of the Peaceful Warrior&#148; a/k/a &#147;Peaceful
Warrior&#148;.
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">1. <B>Picture: </B>The &#147;Picture&#148; shall mean that certain motion picture presently entitled &#147;The Way of
the Peaceful Warrior&#148; a/k/a &#147;Peaceful Warrior&#148; and any and all versions thereof and all &#147;bloopers&#148;,
footage, trims and outtakes thereof (including, without limitation, the Director&#146;s Cut and the
Final Cut and any and all versions of each of the foregoing, all versions rated by the Motion
Picture Association of America and unrated versions of the Picture, &#147;behind the scenes&#148;, &#147;making
of&#148; and any and all other documentary or short films concerning the Picture, and all footage,
&#147;bloopers&#148;, trims and out-takes of each of the foregoing), produced by, on behalf of or at
Grantor&#146;s direction, in the year 2005.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">2. <B>Territory: </B>The &#147;Territory&#148; shall mean and include each of the following: (a)&nbsp;United States of
America (including but not limited to, Guam, Saipan, Midway Island, the Trust Territory Islands,
the Caroline Islands, the Marshall Islands, the Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico and American Samoa)
(&#147;U. S.&#148;), its territories, possessions, trusteeships and commonwealths and all military bases,
ships at sea, airlines and oil rigs flying the flag or serviced from of the U.S., (b)&nbsp;Canada
(including, but not limited to, Quebec, Prince Edward Island, the Northwest Territories, the Yukon
Territories and Newfoundland), its territories, possessions, trusteeships and commonwealths, and
all military bases, ships at sea, airlines and oil rigs flying the flag of or serviced from Canada,
and (c)&nbsp;for the purposes of Television exploitation in the U.S. only, Bermuda and the Bahamas
Islands.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">3. <B>Rights Granted:</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;a.&nbsp;<U>Rights Granted to LGF</U>: Grantor hereby grants to LGF, on an exclusive basis, all
distribution rights in and to the Picture and the underlying material with respect thereto (to the
extent necessary to effectuate the grant of Rights hereunder), under copyright and otherwise,
throughout the Territory, in all languages and in all media, whether now known or hereafter
devised, including, without limitation, all Theatrical, Non-Theatrical, Home Video, and Television
Rights in and to the Picture, by all methods of delivery, whether now know or hereafter devised,
including without limitation, all Internet Delivery Mechanisms, all as such rights may be more
specifically defined in Schedule &#147;A&#148;, which is attached hereto and incorporated herein by this
reference (collectively, the &#147;Rights&#148;), excluding without limitation, all Ancillary Rights and all
the sequel, prequel and remake rights in and to the Picture (including, without limitation, any and
all Television spin-off rights), the Blockbuster Store Rights (as that
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;The Way of the Peaceful Warrior&#148; a/k/a &#147;Peaceful Warrior&#148;<BR>
DM. 10<BR>
Page 2

</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">term is defined in paragraph 3(b) hereinbelow, and all Ancillary Rights (as that term is defined in
paragraph 3(c) hereinbelow) in and to the Picture (collectively, the &#147;Reserved Rights&#148;). Without
limiting the generality of the foregoing, the Rights granted to LGF hereunder shall include,
without limitation, the exclusive right to market, advertise, promote and publicize the Picture in
all media, whether now known or hereafter devised.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;b.&nbsp;<U>Remakes, Prequels &#038; Sequels</U>: LGF shall have a right of first refusal (a &#147;Right of
First Refusal&#148;) with respect to worldwide distribution rights in any motion picture produced by
Grantor alone or in conjunction with others during the Term (a &#147;Qualifying Picture&#148;) to the extent
that Grantor controls the licensing of such distribution rights; provided, that such Right of First
Refusal shall not apply to any rights to distribute a Qualifying Picture which has been licensed,
transferred or otherwise disposed of prior to the time that Grantor controls the licensing of such
distribution rights unless at such later time Grantor has obtained the control of the Subject
Distribution Rights. Such a Right of First Refusal shall apply to all rights to distribute the
Qualifying Picture in the United States (&#147;U.S. Rights&#148;) and to all rights to distribute the
Qualifying Picture outside of the United States (&#147;Foreign Rights&#148;). The rights as to which LGF has
the Right of First Refusal set forth in this paragraph shall be referred to herein as &#147;Subject
Distribution Rights&#148;.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;i.&nbsp;Grantor shall notify LGF in writing of any Qualifying Picture (a &#147;First Refusal Notice&#148;)
setting forth a description of the Material Elements. For purposes of this Agreement, &#147;Material
Elements&#148; shall mean the proposed director, lead actor and amount of the budget for the Qualifying
Picture. LGF shall have until 5:00 p.m. on the eighth (8<SUP style="font-size: 85%; vertical-align: text-top">th</SUP>) business day following
provision of the First Refusal Notice by Grantor (the &#147;Exercise Period&#148;) to notify Grantor in
writing (an &#147;Exercise Notice&#148;) that LGF is exercising its right to negotiate in good faith to
acquire the U.S. Rights and/or the Foreign Rights. If LGF so exercises its Right of First Refusal
with respect to the U.S. Rights and/or with respect to the Foreign Rights, LGF shall thereupon be
obligated to negotiate with Grantor in good faith for a period of ten (10)&nbsp;business days
(&#147;Negotiation Period&#148;).
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;ii.&nbsp;If the parties fail to reach agreement ( or are deemed to fail to reach agreement) prior
to the expiration of the Negotiation Period with respect to U.S. Rights and/or Foreign Rights,
subject to and in accordance with subsections (iv)&nbsp;and (v)&nbsp;below, Grantor may accept any third
party offer to acquire U.S. rights and/or Foreign Rights on monetary terms or conditions materially
more favorable to Grantor that the monetary terms and conditions last offered by LGF to Grantor
during the Negotiation Period and/ or may sell or license Foreign Rights on a territory-by
territory basis without any further obligation to LGF.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;iii.&nbsp;LGF&#146;s failure to provide an Exercise Notice prior to the expiration of the Exercise
Period shall be deemed an election by LGF to not exercise its Right of First Refusal to acquire any
of the Subject Distribution Rights. In the event LGF fails to provide an Exercise Notice within the
applicable Exercise Period or fails to negotiate with Grantor during the appropriate Negotiation
Period, Grantor shall have the right to dispose of the Subject Distribution Rights with respect to
Qualifying Picture without any further obligation to LGF.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;The Way of the Peaceful Warrior&#148; a/k/a &#147;Peaceful Warrior&#148;<BR>
DM. 10<BR>
Page 3

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;iv.&nbsp;Subject to paragraph 3(b)(v) hereinbelow, if at any time there is a substantial change in
the Material Elements pertaining to a Qualifying Picture, Grantor shall within ten (10)&nbsp;business
days following such change to provide a First Refusal Notice to LGF describing such change of
Material Elements. The Exercise Period, Negotiation Period and the mechanics for LGF&#146;s exercise or
deemed election not to exercise its rights under any such First Refusal Notice shall be the same as
set forth above. For purposes of this Agreement, a &#147;substantial change&#148; in the Material Elements
pertaining to a Qualifying Picture shall mean (A)&nbsp;any change in the proposed director or lead actor
or (B)&nbsp;a decrease of more than ten percent (10%) in the amount of the proposed budget.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;v.&nbsp;Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Agreement, if Grantor enters into an
agreement with a third party regarding the U.S. Rights or the Foreign Rights in Qualifying Picture,
thereafter there is a substantial change in Material Elements pertaining to such Qualifying
Picture, and Grantor has theretofore compiled with his first refusal obligations as set forth
herein, LGF&#146;s Right of First Refusal shall not apply to such Qualifying Picture. By way of
clarification, in such event, Grantor would, among other things, not be required to provide a
subsequent First Refusal Notice to LGF with respect to a Qualifying Picture, even if the Material
Elements of such Qualifying Picture were to change substantially subsequent to the time such
agreement is entered into.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;c.&nbsp;<U>Blockbuster Store Rights</U>: LGF acknowledges that Sobini has entered into a revenue
sharing agreement with Blockbuster Inc. (&#147;Blockbuster&#148;) with respect to the rental of DVDs
(including, without limitation, Blu-Ray&#153;) of the Picture for the first twenty-six (26)&nbsp;weeks
commencing with LGF&#146;s initial Home Video Street Date of the Picture (the &#147;Revenue Share Period&#148;)
via (i)&nbsp;Blockbuster&#146;s &#147;brick and mortar&#148; retail stores or locations in the Territory with the
limited exception of stores or locations located in Hawaii or Alaska or any United States&#146;
territory or possession other than the District of Columbia (the &#147;Blockbuster Territory&#148;) that are
wholly owned or operated by Blockbuster or its affiliates (the &#147;Blockbuster Parties&#148;); and (ii)
blockbuster.com (collectively, the &#147;Blockbuster Store Rights&#148;). LGF further acknowledges that this
Picture will not be a &#147;Rental Picture&#148; under any revenue share agreement between LGF and
Blockbuster that is or will be in effect as of LGF&#146;s initial Home Video Street Date of the Picture
(i.e., any &#147;brick and mortar&#148; or online revenue share agreement). For clarification purposes, LGF
will not be prohibited or restricted from selling Videograms (including, without limitation, DVDs)
of the Picture to any of the Blockbuster Parties for retail purposes in the Blockbuster Territory
prior to or during the Revenue Share Period nor will LGF be prohibited or restricted from selling
Videograms (including, without limitation, DVDs) of the Picture to any of the Blockbuster Parties
in the Blockbuster Territory for retail and/or rental purposes after the expiration of the Revenue
Share Period. &#147;Videograms&#148; means and includes, without limitation, all kinds of tapes, cassettes,
discs, chips, cards and other devices, whether now known or hereafter devised, including but not
limited to, all formats of videotapes, videocassettes, videodiscs, chips, cards, and other
technologies in which the Picture is embodied in a tangible medium of expression (including,
without limitation, VHS, DVD, PSP, Blu-Ray&#153; and laser discs), as these terms are commonly
understood in the video industry which contain the Picture, or portions thereof and are intended
primarily for viewing of the Picture in its original continuity.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;The Way of the Peaceful Warrior&#148; a/k/a &#147;Peaceful Warrior&#148;<BR>
DM. 10<BR>
Page 4

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;d.&nbsp;<U>Specialty Home Video Markets</U>: LGF shall use good faith efforts to engage Gaiam to
handle the distribution of Video Devices of the Picture in certain non-mass-merchant and specialty
Home Video markets, provided that (i)&nbsp;LGF approves all of the terms of such distribution agreement
with Gaiam, and (ii)&nbsp;LGF approves of the specific retail chains to be handled by Gaiam under such
agreement.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;e.&nbsp;<U>Ancillary Rights</U>: As used herein, &#147;Ancillary Rights&#148; shall mean and include,
without limitation, all Soundtrack, Music Publishing, Literary Publishing, Electronic Publishing
and Merchandising Rights in and to the Picture. Notwithstanding any reservation of the Ancillary
Rights in and to the Picture, LGF is hereby granted the exclusive right to merchandise the key art
in and to the Picture (e.g., posters, toys, key chains, etc.) for the purposes of promoting the
Picture in the Territory.
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">4. <B>Term: </B>The &#147;Term&#148; of this Agreement shall commence as of the date first written above and shall
terminate ten (10)&nbsp;years from LGF&#146;s initial Theatrical release of the Picture in the Territory
(which Theatrical release shall be deemed to have occurred on the earlier of (a)&nbsp;the actual initial
commercial Theatrical release date of the Picture in the Territory, and (b)&nbsp;twelve (12)&nbsp;months from
the date of complete Delivery (and LGF&#146;s acceptance) of the Picture in accordance with the Delivery
Schedule). Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Term of this Agreement shall be deemed extended as
is necessary to comply with any license of Television Rights to Showtime Networks Inc.. After the
expiration of the Term, there shall be a six (6)&nbsp;month exclusive sell-off period (the &#147;Sell-Off
Period&#148;). During the Sell-Off Period, LGF shall only manufacture that number of Video Devices LGF
reasonable requires in order to fill orders during the Sell-Off Period. LGF shall not manufacture
more Video Devices during the last six (6)&nbsp;months of the Term than it reasonably expects to sell
during the Term, exclusive of the Sell-Off Period. Without limiting the generality of the
foregoing, LGF shall have a right of first negotiation (for a period of ten (10)&nbsp;business days
commencing on Grantor&#146;s receipt of LGF&#146;s written notice of its intent to commence such
negotiations, which notice shall be Delivered to Grantor no later than the last day of the Term)
with respect to any extensions of the Term hereof.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">5. <B>Minimum Guarantee: </B>None.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">6. <B>Grantor&#146;s Participation; Distribution Fees:</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;a.&nbsp;<U>Grantor&#146;s Participation</U>: From One Hundred Percent (100%) of all monies received by
LGF on a non-refundable basis from the exploitation of the Picture in all media throughout the
Territory, LGF shall be entitled to deduct the following on a continuing basis and in the following
order: (i)&nbsp;LGF&#146;s Distribution Fee for all media, (ii)&nbsp;LGF&#146;s Distribution Expenses (as that term is
defined hereinbelow) plus Interest, and (iii)&nbsp;third party participation payments (to the extent
that LGF pays such third party participation payments on Grantor&#146;s behalf, if at all, and which
shall only be payable from any monies remaining after the foregoing deductions; for the purposes of
clarity, LGF shall not be required to assume any payment obligations of Grantor nor shall LGF be
required to make any third party participation payment that is greater than the amount of revenues
available after LGF has first deducted its Distribution Fees and Distribution Expenses). All
revenues remaining after the foregoing deductions shall be referred to herein as
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;The Way of the Peaceful Warrior&#148; a/k/a &#147;Peaceful Warrior&#148;<BR>
DM. 10<BR>
Page 5

</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;AGR&#148;. Grantor shall be entitled to receive One Hundred Percent (100%) of the AGR.
Notwithstanding the foregoing, in the event that LGF contributes Two Million Dollars
($2,000,000.00) or more in actual, direct, out-of-pocket, third party print, marketing,
advertising, promotional and publicity expenses in connection with the theatrical release of the
Picture, then One Hundred Percent (100%) of the AGR shall paid to Grantor until such time, if ever,
as Grantor has received the aggregate of Two Million Five Hundred Thousand Dollars ($2,500,000.00)
under this Agreement plus an amount equal to any and all monies drawn down from the LC by LGF
pursuant to paragraph 6(c)(i) hereinbelow. Thereafter, the AGR shall be allocated and paid Ten
Percent (10%) to LGF and Ninety Percent (90%) to Grantor for the duration of the Term. That
portion of the AGR allocated to Grantor pursuant to this paragraph shall be referred to herein as
&#147;Grantor&#146;s Participation&#148;. LGF shall be entitled to cross-collateralize all revenues received by
LGF from the exploitation of the Picture from all media throughout the Territory for the purposes
of recouping LGF&#146;s recoupable Distribution Expenses. LGF shall be entitled to hold a reasonable
amount of Home Video Gross Receipts in reserve to accommodate bad debt, returns, damaged goods,
residuals and the like, which reserves shall be liquidated on an annual basis in accordance with
LGF&#146;s standard business practices. The amount of reserves held by LGF commencing on LGF&#146;s initial
Home Video release of the Picture in the Territory and continuing for a consecutive twelve (12)
month period thereafter shall not exceed twenty-seven percent (27%) of Home Video Gross Receipts.
Thereafter, the amount of reserves held by LGF shall not exceed thirty (percent (30%) of Home Video
Gross Receipts. Nothing set forth herein shall preclude LGF from making adjustments to its
reporting statements to reflect the actual or anticipated rate of returns, damaged goods, and the
like. LGF shall not be entitled to cross-collateralize revenues received by LGF from the
exploitation of the Picture with revenues received by LGF from the exploitation of any other motion
picture or property distributed by LGF for any recoupment purposes, including, but not limited to,
recoupment of its Distribution Expenses. The Picture shall not be treated as a &#147;loss leader&#148; by
LGF. If LGF includes the Picture in a package of motion pictures licensed to a third party, then
the price allocated to the Picture shall be on the basis of a reasonable allocation of revenues in
light of the commercial worth of the motion pictures in the package as determined by LGF in the
exercise of its reasonable good faith business judgment.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;b.&nbsp;<U>Distribution Fees</U>: LGF&#146;s &#147;Distribution Fee&#148; shall equal Fifteen Percent (15%) of
One Hundred Percent (100%) of all Gross Receipts received by LGF from the exploitation of the
Picture in all media throughout the Territory.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;c.&nbsp;<U>Distribution Expenses</U>: As used herein, &#147;Distribution Expenses&#148; shall mean, with
respect to all rights granted to LGF hereunder, one hundred percent (100%) of the aggregate of all
actual, direct, out-of-pocket, third party costs expended or incurred by LGF in direct connection
with the distribution and exploitation of the Picture throughout the Territory in all media,
including, without limitation, all DLT Creation Costs, and all conversion, manufacturing,
duplication, shipping, marketing, advertising, promotion and publicity costs, all Residual
Payments, and all costs to complete Delivery of the Picture (to the extent (i)&nbsp;LGF elects to cure
any failure of Grantor to complete Delivery of the Picture in accordance with the Delivery Schedule
and/or (ii)&nbsp;LGF is required to take &#147;access&#148; to any Delivery Materials pursuant to the Delivery
Schedule; and/or (iii)&nbsp;Grantor is not required to deliver such elements under the Delivery
Schedule).
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;The Way of the Peaceful Warrior&#148; a/k/a &#147;Peaceful Warrior&#148;<BR>
DM. 10<BR>
Page 6

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;i.&nbsp;<U>P&#038;A Contribution</U>: Grantor shall pay LGF the sum of Two Million Dollars
($2,000,000.00) (the &#147;P&#038;A Contribution&#148;) in the form of an irrevocable letter of credit (&#147;LC&#148;),
which LC shall be Delivered to LGF on or before March&nbsp;31, 2006. LGF shall be entitled to draw down
from the LC, without restriction, commencing on that date which is eighteen (18)&nbsp;months following
the first day of the initial commercial theatrical release of the Picture in the Territory (or
earlier if LGF determines in good faith that it will not recoup its Distribution Fees and
Distribution Expenses (including, but not limited to, its marketing, advertising, promotional,
publicity and print (&#147;P&#038;A&#148;) expenditure in connection with the initial Theatrical release of the
Picture in the Territory) based on the performance of the Picture) and continuing until that date
which is twenty-four (24)&nbsp;months after the commencement of the initial commercial Theatrical
release of the Picture in the Territory. Such LC shall only be drawn upon to the extent that Gross
Receipts fail to equal LGF&#146;s Distribution Fees plus LGF&#146;s Distribution Expenses (together with
Interest thereon) as of the date(s) the LC is drawn upon. By way of example, if LGF spends
$2,000,000.00 in connection with the initial commercial theatrical release of the Picture in the
Territory (representing Grantor&#146;s P&#038;A Contribution), $2,000,000 in other Distribution Expenses
(including interest) and Gross Receipts equal $4,000,000.00, then LGF shall only be entitled to
draw $600,000.00 from the LC. One Hundred Percent (100%) of the P&#038;A Contribution shall be spent by
LGF in actual, direct, out-of-pocket, third party, print, marketing, advertising, promotional and
publicity costs incurred in connection with the Theatrical release of the Picture in the Territory.
LGF and Grantor shall have the right of mutual approval of the amount, if any, that LGF
contributes to the theatrical release of the Picture.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;ii.&nbsp;<U>Grantor&#146;s Approval Rights</U>: Grantor shall have the right of approval of the amount
of the initial print and advertising expenditure in connection with the initial commercial
theatrical release of the Picture in the Territory (provided that LGF is pre-approved to spend the
P&#038;A Contribution) and the initial marketing and advertising expenditure in connection with the
initial Home Video release of the Picture in the Territory. Without limiting the generality of the
foregoing, Grantor shall have the right of approval of the initial marketing plan for the initial
Theatrical and Home Video releases of the Picture in the Territory. Without limiting the
generality of the foregoing, Grantor shall have the right of approval of the initial markets in
which the Picture shall be initially theatrically released (Los Angeles, San Francisco, San Diego,
Phoenix, Portland and Seattle are pre-approved). In each instance, Grantor&#146;s approval shall not be
unreasonably withheld or untimely delayed and shall be deemed given if not rejected within ten (10)
business days of Grantor&#146;s receipt of LGF&#146;s written request for approval, except that once the
Theatrical release of the Picture has commenced, Grantor&#146;s approval shall be deemed given if not
rejected within two (2)&nbsp;business days of Grantor&#146;s receipt of LGF&#146;s written request for approval.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;d.&nbsp;<U>Interest</U>: As used herein, &#147;Interest&#148; shall mean the actual rate of interest
charged to LGF by LGF&#146;s principal lending syndicate, which rate, as between LGF and Grantor, shall
not exceed the prime rate of interest plus two percent (2%).
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;e.&nbsp;<U>Residuals</U>: Grantor represents and warrants that no residual buy-outs are permitted
by any guild or union affiliated with the Picture or those individuals rendering services in
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;The Way of the Peaceful Warrior&#148; a/k/a &#147;Peaceful Warrior&#148;<BR>
DM. 10<BR>
Page 7

</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">connection therewith (the &#147;Residual Buy-Out&#148;). Without limiting the generality of the foregoing,
Grantor shall be responsible for any and all residual and other additional or supplemental payments
required to be made by reason of the distribution or other exploitation of the Picture in the
Territory. Notwithstanding the foregoing, LGF represents and warrants that it shall pay any
residual payments Grantor is required to pay as a result of LGF&#146;s exploitation of the Picture in
the Territory other than the Residual Buy-Out and LGF shall sign Distributor&#146;s Assumption
Agreements in connection therewith (each, a &#147;Residual Payment&#148;). Grantor represents and warrants
to LGF that the Picture was produced under the SAG Basic Agreement and not under the SAG Low
Budget, Ultra Low Budget or Modified Low Budget Basic Agreements (collectively, the &#147;SAG Low Budget
Agreements&#148;). Grantor hereby represents and warrants to LGF that LGF shall not be required to pay
any residual or other guild penalties hereunder, except with respect to those penalties that may
arise as a result of LGF&#146;s failure to timely pay such residual payments (subject to LGF&#146;s receipt
of timely written notice of its obligation to pay such residuals and the amount thereof). For the
purposes of clarity, LGF shall not be responsible for paying any additional up-front compensation
to any guild whatsoever, including, without limitation, the WGC, ACTRA, the DGC, DGA, WGA, IATSE,
SAG or to any SAG cast members in order to qualify the Picture for distribution beyond that
permitted under any SAG Low Budget Agreement. In this regard, Grantor shall complete the Residuals
Worksheet which is attached hereto and incorporated herein by this reference as Schedule &#147;B&#148;.
Delivery of a completed Schedule &#147;B&#148; is a condition precedent to Delivery of the Picture being
deemed complete. LGF shall be entitled to recoup all Residual Payments as Distribution Expenses
hereunder.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;f.&nbsp;<U>DLT Creation Costs</U>: As used herein, the term &#147;DLT Creation Costs&#148; shall mean and
include 100% of LGF&#146;s actual, direct, out-of-pocket, third party costs of creating the DLT(s) for
the Picture, including, without limitation, DVD mastering and authoring costs, manufacturing,
duplication, and shipping and clearance costs (including, without limitation, the cost of clearing
&#147;bonus&#148; materials for such DVD).
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">7. <B>Delivery: </B>Grantor shall deliver, at Grantor&#146;s sole cost and expense, all Delivery Materials (as
that term is defined in the Delivery Schedule) set forth in the Delivery Schedule to LGF on or
before March&nbsp;13, 2006 (the &#147;Delivery Date&#148;), except with respect to long form music licenses, for
which the Delivery Date shall be April&nbsp;17, 2006. The Delivery Schedule shall be negotiated by
the parties in good faith. Without limitation to those requirements set forth in the Delivery
Schedule, all documents required to be Delivered to LGF pursuant to the Delivery Schedule shall be
Delivered in the English language.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;a.&nbsp;<U>Running Time</U>: The Picture shall be Delivered to LGF with a running time of not
less than ninety (90)&nbsp;minutes, nor more than one hundred twenty (120)&nbsp;minutes, inclusive of main
and end titles.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;b.&nbsp;<U>Rating</U>: The Picture shall be delivered to LGF having been judged to receive a
rating by the M.P.A.A. that is no more restrictive than &#147;PG-13&#148;. Provided that the Picture is
Delivered to LGF as set forth in the preceding sentence, LGF shall not edit the Picture for
M.P.A.A. rating purposes. If the Picture is not Delivered to LGF having been judged to receive an
M.P.A.A.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt">&nbsp;
</DIV>
